title: A New Look at Vaccination Behaviors and Intentions: The Case of Influenza.
abstract: Although viral outbreaks are increasing, vaccination rates are decreasing. Our aim was to explain this baffling behavior that seems to contradict rational self-interest, and, thus, be beyond the purview of rational choice theories. We integrated fuzzy-trace theory and major theoretical alternatives and applied them to influenza, testing theoretical predictions in two samples: young adults (who are major viral vectors),
